intro: Phyllorkis hirta, commonly known as the hairy phyllorkis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white or pinkish flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal areas. Phyllorkis hirta is often found in heathlands and is adapted to withstand coastal conditions.
